definitions.definition: Having a small distance from one end or edge to another, either horizontally or vertically .

examples: Our meeting was a short six minutes today. Every day for the past month it’s been at least twenty minutes long.

definitions.definition: Of a word or phrase, constituting an abbreviation (for another) or shortened form (of another).
examples: "Phone" is short for "telephone" and "asap" short for "as soon as possible".

definitions.definition: that is relatively close to the batsman .
labels: of a fielder or fielding position
definitions.label_groups: cricket , of a fielder or fielding position

definitions.definition: bowled so that it bounces relatively far from the batsman.
that falls short of the green or the hole.
labels: of an approach shot or putt
definitions.label_groups: golf , of an approach shot or putt

definitions.definition: Of betting odds , offering a small return for the money wagered.
Brittle , crumbly . ( See shortbread , shortcake , shortcrust , shortening , hot short , cold-short . )

examples: He gave a short answer to the question.

definitions.definition: Limited in quantity; inadequate; insufficient; scanty.
Insufficiently provided; inadequately supplied, especially with money; scantily furnished; lacking.
examples: I'd lend you the cash but I'm a little short at present.
The cashier came up short ten dollars on his morning shift.

definitions.definition: Deficient; less; not coming up to a measure or standard.
examples: an account which is short of the truth

definitions.definition: Not distant in time; near at hand.
Being in a financial investment position that is structured to be profitable if the price of the underlying security declines in the future.
examples: I'm short in General Motors because I think their sales are plunging.

definitions.definition: Of money : given in the fewest possible notes, i.e. those of the largest denomination .

main_definition: Having a small distance from one end or edge to another, either horizontally or vertically .
secondary_definitions: ( of a person ) Of comparatively small height .
( followed by for ) Of a word or phrase, constituting an abbreviation (for another) or shortened form (of another).
( cricket , of a fielder or fielding position ) that is relatively close to the batsman .
( cricket , of a ball ) bowled so that it bounces relatively far from the batsman.
( golf , of an approach shot or putt ) that falls short of the green or the hole.
( gambling ) Of betting odds , offering a small return for the money wagered.
( baking , of pastries; metallurgy ) Brittle , crumbly . ( See shortbread , shortcake , shortcrust , shortening , hot short , cold-short . )
Limited in quantity; inadequate; insufficient; scanty.
Insufficiently provided; inadequately supplied, especially with money; scantily furnished; lacking.
Deficient; less; not coming up to a measure or standard.
( obsolete ) Not distant in time; near at hand.
( finance ) Being in a financial investment position that is structured to be profitable if the price of the underlying security declines in the future.
( by extension ) Doubtful of, skeptical of.
( finance , dated ) Of money : given in the fewest possible notes, i.e. those of the largest denomination .
